title: Firefox does not create defaults/pref folder on MacOS
content:
Starting with version 126.0.0, firefox for MacOS stopped creating a defaults/pref folder during installation. If you create it yourself and add the autoconfig.js there, and add firefox.cfg to the root, firefox reads them perfectly and applies the settings. However, if you create folders before the first launch of the browser after installation, the file integrity check fails (see screenshot).

I couldn't find any information about why the folders stopped being created. Maybe someone knows?

The newest article regarding the configuration seems to be this one:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/customizing-firefox-using-autoconfig
creator: maxmtrushin

title: Facebook Group Calls Problem
content: Whenever I use FaceBook group calls, most of time I am not able to hear other FB users but they can hear me. This typically happens for the 2nd group call in login session. the way I am trying to resolve currently is log off, clear data and history in Firefox browser and then re-login and there is no problem. I do not know why this problem occurs only in Firefox, I do not see this issue in other browsers such as Chrome or Edge. can you please identify the cause and resolve it, it is very irritating. or let me know the solution for this issue.

title: Exporting a certificate
content: Hi! I have a new laptop and want to export a certificate I had installed in my previous laptop. When trying to do so, I'm asked to choose a certificate backup password which I need to enter twice to validate. Once I do it, this message comes up, "Failed to create the PKCS #12 backup file for unknown reasons". I've tried several times with different passwords but the same issue remains. Can you please help me out with this? Many thanks! Alex

title: Firefox starting as normal, operating as normal for ninety seconds to two or three minutes, then shuts down
content:
Last night I was using Firefox normally when it abruptly closed all windows and turned off. I turned it back on again. It told me it could not restore the tabs, so I started a new session. Firefox behaved normally, went to the sites I asked, and in approximately two minutes, did the same thing. Simply closed as if I had closed it. Turn it back on. It says it cannot restore previous tabs. It will come on, go to requested site, operate normally for a very short time, then close without warning. Made sure I had the latest version of Firefox. I do. Have tried hard restart, turn computer off, turn it back on. Same. Have tried uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox. Behaves the same on reinstall. Says it cannot restore tabs. Start new session. Brief period of normal behavior, then all windows close as if turned off. Does not matter what the site is I go to.

Please note that I am an older autistic person who is very computer illiterate and is extremely distressed by these events. Please bear with me and please be patient with me.
creator: godunderfoot
